fields.summary: Recovery may get very slow with lots of services with lots of app-attempts

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
Configure 3 queue in cluster with 8 GB
# queue 40%
# queue 50% 
# default 10%

* Submit applications to all 3 queue with container size as 1024MB (sleep job with 50 containers on all queues)
* AM that gets assigned to default queue and gets preempted immediately after 20 preemption kill all application

Due resource limit in default queue AM got prempted about 20 times 
On RM restart RM fails to restart

{noformat}
2016-01-12 10:49:04,081 DEBUG org.apache.hadoop.service.AbstractService: noteFailure java.lang.NullPointerException
2016-01-12 10:49:04,081 INFO org.apache.hadoop.service.AbstractService: Service RMActiveServices failed in state STARTED; cause: java.lang.NullPointerException
java.lang.NullPointerException

fields.summary: RM startup failure when AM attempts greater than max-attempts

comments.body: [~bibinchundatt] Thanks for reporting the issue. It seems the attempt's data is missed?  If yes, the patch for YARN-4497 might could solve the problem.
[~hex108] Thank you . Closing as duplicate
[~bibinchundatt] Thanks for confirming it.

[~hex108]

Am attempts before recovery was about 31 and max attempts was 3. So on recovery 1-28 got removed from appstore.
so those attempts where causing NPE and RM recovery was failing.

In HA node of the RM will be able to become Active
In HA none of the RM will be able to become Active
[~bibinchundatt] If attempt 1~28 are removed and attempt 29~31 has been saved to appstore successfully, there will be no NPE for RM recovery. Could you share more RM log? Thanks.

Hi [~hex108]

{noformat}
2016-01-13 13:37:02,475 WARN org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.resourcemanager.RMAuditLogger: USER=dsperf   OPERATION=transitionToActive    TARGET=RM       RESULT=FAILURE  DESCRIPTION=Exception transitioning to active   PERMISSIONS=

org.apache.hadoop.ha.ServiceFailedException: RM could not transition to Active

        ... 5 more
2016-01-13 13:37:02,475 INFO org.apache.hadoop.ha.ActiveStandbyElector: Trying to re-establish ZK session
{noformat}

Caused by below part of code in  {{RMAppAttemptImpl#recover}}
{noformat}
    ApplicationAttemptStateData attemptState =
        appState.getAttempt(getAppAttemptId());
    assert attemptState != null;
    LOG.info("Recovering attempt: " + getAppAttemptId() + " with final state: "
        + attemptState.getState());
{noformat}

After YARN-3480 On recovery the excess attempts removed are listed below

{noformat}
016-01-13 13:35:32,388 INFO org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.resourcemanager.rmapp.RMAppImpl: Remove attempt from state store : appattempt_1452672118921_0002_000001
2016-01-13 13:35:42,294 INFO org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.resourcemanager.rmapp.RMAppImpl: Remove attempt from state store : appattempt_1452672118921_0002_000002
{noformat}

{{ApplicationAttemptStateData attemptState}} attemptstate is *null*.For *appattempt_1452672118921_0002_000001* since  recovery its tried and state is returned as null hence NPE and HA issue . After the i applied patch of YARN-4497 the recovery looks fine.

[~hex108]
RM log is large couldnt upload the logs complete.During debug i found the above. How to reproduce also i have updated the describtion

[~bibinchundatt] Thanks for the help! 
Could you please provide more log about recovering the app's attempts if it is OK? The result of {code}grep  _1452672118921_  ${RM_LOG_FILE}{code} will be enough. Thanks!

Reopening the issue as I provided [analysis|https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/YARN-4497?focusedCommentId=15097653&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-15097653] for NPE.

[~rohithsharma]
Thank you for looking into the issue . As per the discussion attaching patch for review.
Testcase also added for recovery failure.

This message was automatically generated.

[~rohithsharma]
Testcase failures are not related to patch attached

I have one question, normally, if FailuresValidityInterval <=0, no attempts will be removed from store, because the number of attempts should always be <= max-attempts.
But if attempts were failed for the reasons like preempted, disk failed ( see RMAppImpl#shouldCountTowardsMaxAttemptRetry), even if FailuresValidityInterval is <= 0, the number of attempts could go beyond max-attempt.
Is this the scenario you are running into ?

[~jianhe]
The AM is getting pre-empted and exceeds the max limit in my case.

I had offline discussion with [~jianhe] regarding this issue. And fix summary is as follows.
# Do not remove the attempts if attemptFailuresValidityInterval <=0.
# Remove the excess attempts which are only beyond attemptFailuresValidityInterval.

This message was automatically generated.

Overall patch looks neat. 
nits : Test : wait for killed state after killing app.

bq. Do we need to deal with these cases?
I understand your concern that if attempts fails continuously with above cases, number of attempt count will be more.
Consider another case, Say, what if any attempts are really failed? Ex : Max attempt is 5. A1-A4 killed. A5 and A6 failed with above mentioned case. A7 really failed. Here, Total number of failed count is 5(shouldCountForMaxAttempt) and next attempt A8 should be launched?. So should maxAttempt considered? Since all attempts nevertheless of validity interval was deleted, Attempt still keep launching.. 

I am open to get convinced too..

[~rohithsharma]

[~jianhe] /[~rohithsharma]/[~hex108]

Could you please review patch attached. 

For removing AM attempts caused by preemption and diskfailures also we can consider the probability of those cases during the {{attemptFailuresValidityInterval}} AM containers are chosen last  for preemption . Also for disk failure case for AM we do have AM blacklisting . So  attempts with out failures will be limited rt?.

the patch looks fine to me, thanks 
[~rohithsharma], [~hex108], any other comments?

Thanks for comment. Yes, maxAttempt need be considered, it makes things a little complex, and might cause NPE before YARN-4497 is accepted. We could ignore it in this patch. If needed, I could test it in our cluster and create another issue to handle it.
[~bibinchundatt] Thanks for the patch, the patch looks good to me too.
+1 LGTM, committing shortly

[~bibinchundatt] While committing I observed that the test case is placed on {{TestResourceManager.java}}. Since it is related to RMRestart , would you mind placing same test case in TestRMRestart. This will be helpful for maintenance. 
Apologies for not observing this earlier.
Attaching patch after moving testcase
